website_summaries.verdict: Though you may want to pass on this kit if your tub has a porous finish, it's a neat way to add color and creativity to youngsters' bath time.
pros: Offers a unique way to add fun to bath time, thanks to the colorful bathtub crayons and 60 fizz tablets that tint water
cons: Although the cleanup is easy in most circumstances, the colors have been known to stain some tub surfaces
Crayons feel somewhat waxy – most parents and kids like the fizz tablets best

customer_reviews.title: Toddler will take a bath again!!!
customer_reviews.text: At 17 months, my son randomly became terrified of taking baths. After months of just holding in the the shower, we went back to the tub. Still terrified. These crayons did the trick!!! He loves them and is happy to take a bath now. Bright lovely colors! Easily wipe off with a wet cloth post bath.
customer_reviews.author: EMB

customer_reviews.title: Awful, please don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Crayons arrived broken but not used- they didn't even hold up to shipping I guess- these are very fragile and when I let my daughter try to use them anyway, they just kept breaking till they were nubs. She was in tears. Not happy, not a good product. The bath drops are fine but the crayons are terrible. Also beware- I have rough not smooth grout and the crayon was very difficult to remove- had to use a scrub brush and bleach.
customer_reviews.author: Ally Kelly

customer_reviews.title: No stains, lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Big hit with my almost 3 year old son, no staining in my tub from the products either. I'd buy again
customer_reviews.author: elicia

customer_reviews.title: Great bath tub crayons
customer_reviews.text: We were looking to spice up our 2 year old's bath time. He likes these crayons and they are easy to clean up. He cleans up with his washcloth when he is done coloring. We also have "school" in the bathtub with numbers and letters. These crayons are fun and educational if you get creative! The bath drops are fun, but we prefer the crayons.
customer_reviews.author: OT in NC

customer_reviews.title: Fun and easy clean up
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year old loved these crayons and bath drops. We have tile walls in the bathroom and a ceramic tub so clean up was pretty quick and easy. I had to scrub a little more with the red but overall it was easy. I did also do clean up immediately after bath time. The bath drops made the water a nice blue color and doesn't stay on skin. My son really enjoyed both!
customer_reviews.author: maggiemay

customer_reviews.title: don't buy
customer_reviews.text: First of all we only got 2 bath tab colors so that was a huge disappointment. 2ndly the crayons weren't smooth. You couldn't write with them almost like they are too hard even after soaking in the tub Then it stained our tub and wall. Not happen at all
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: These crayons stain fingers, break easily, and are not easy to scrub off the bathtub or tiles. Fail all around. The pellets aren’t great either. We add 6-7 pellets and it tints they water a little. Ordered Honey Sticks brand bath color drops and 1 pellet would change the color of the tub water dramatically without staining the tub (or the toddler). Going to try Honey Sticks crayons. More expensive but better than hearing a toddler say, “Mommy deese crayons aren’t bery good. Let’s throw dem in the garbage.”
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Rose

customer_reviews.title: The crayons will stain white grout
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as he loves bath time and is always looking for something fun to play with. The color drops are perfect, and helped him learn color combinations as we would select different colors to mix in the bath water. The crayons however will stain white grout. Do not use them! The crown itself comes off of tile easily, but I now have a rainbow grout in my bathtub, which my husband is not happy about. No product has been able to lift the colorful stain off of the grout.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: May strain shower if not cleaned off immediately
customer_reviews.text: First the crayons. Our toddler had lots of fun drawing all over the shower walls with them. The next day we come back to clean it off, and they left a slight strain in our shower. We have scrubbed it with soap on loofa, but it's still there ever so slightly. It seems like cleaning it off immediately prevents the strain from happening. The bath bombs are great. Our toddler loves using the colored water, and it hasn't stained so far that we've noticed, but we also don't let the water sit in the tub like we did with the crayons.
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Crayons have changed...don’t write and hard to clean.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time I’ve purchased the bath crayons. The first time they were fantastic. Kiddo loved them from about 14 mo on. Then I purchased a 2nd set to replace the first when they were running out. The consistency of the crayons was completely different. They were difficult to write with and very difficult to scrub off. I ordered a 3rd set thinking I just got a bad batch. Nope. These were just like the 2nd set....won’t write and terrible to clean. Don’t waste your money! The bath drops are great, though.
customer_reviews.author: Kselund

customer_reviews.title: My kid loved these crayons so much he wrote...
customer_reviews.text: ...on everything. LOL. But it was very easy to clean up (off the tub, the tile, the wall, the light switches, the doors, etc. I just took a wet napkin and wiped it all clean. The kitchen table was a little harder because I let it sit for too long. But it all came off. Note: If your kid goes quiet for several minutes, you may wonder why. :o) Bottom line: He loves the bath crayons and also the color bath tablets. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rated R Cars

customer_reviews.title: Don’t dissolve but stains everything all the same
customer_reviews.text: The tablets are awful. The have the dual feature of not coloring the bath very much while depositing all of the color on the side of the tub and being impossible to clean off. They also don’t dissolve well, the trick there is to put them in a little vinegar before putting in the tub. Which is annoying. The crayons are fine if short lived because my kid just breaks them immediately. I would not pay this much for this set again.
customer_reviews.author: NikolaD

customer_reviews.title: The crayons are a nightmare to clean! Lol
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for the first time and thought my 3 year old would love it. Ofcourse he did. Lol However I did not like the crayons one bit, they stain the tub and the cleaning is horrible. It's like a regular crayon. I had to scrub it to get it off, and it could potentially clog the tub. The fizzy drops are super nice though. I had bought those before and those are definitely easy to clean. DO NOT BUY THE CRAYONS THOUGH! LOL I ended up hiding them from my toddler.
customer_reviews.author: JLTorres:)

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!! NEW FORMULA IS AWFUL!!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought these bath drops many times over the years, both for my daughter and for gifts for her friends. We have loved them... until NOW! The new formula is absolutely awful and a waste of money. The product used to be incredible, but tonight's bath took 4 tabs and barely even registered a light color change. I went to the Crayola website and the only thing the company has said is that it is their vendor's responsibility to deal with the complaints of unsatisfied customers. I am a customer of Crayola, not Centric Beauty LLC. I wish they would stand behind their brand. I will not be purchasing any of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo

customer_reviews.title: Crayons break easy so these are for older kids
customer_reviews.text: The color tabs are great and give good color. These are higher than others, but we want to support a US company. The Crayons were too soft and breaks too easily for our 2+ granddaughter. Older kids with better control could keep them from breaking them I think. These are not solid Crayons these are in a plastic holder like the extendable snap off utility blades used for crafts.
customer_reviews.author: CobraJ

customer_reviews.title: Terrible tabs
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered this combo in the past and it was great. Unfortunately, this time around the bath tabs are terrible. They don't want to dissolve in the water, and if you squish them, there is barely any color in the water after. Huge disappointment from the last batch, which had vibrant colors that easily dissolved. The crayons are great - as expected.
customer_reviews.author: DadaTacThony

customer_reviews.title: Pellets good. Crayons useless and waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Extremely poor crayons. Broke apart when using (or pressing firmly down on wall). Had to hold the crayon in a certain position otherwise it would slide back into the cover. Completely waste of a bath crayon, since you also have to press down hard to get a drawing out of it. Flimsy. Only thing good about this purchase is the color pellets. Toddler love changing and mixing colors. Crayons -1* Pellets 5* Better crayons on amazon.. thicker ones (with less colors) is the first bath crayon pack I got. Crayola crayons are cheap bs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap- drops don’t work
customer_reviews.text: The color drops are awful. Nothing like the crayola brand drops at Walmart. They’re larger in size but do not change the color of the bath water. Hardly make a color at all when crushed in fingers under water. The crayons are cheap. My kids enjoyed the crayons but they don’t make it past one bath. I wouldn’t recommend these for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yes, your grout is probably unsealed.
customer_reviews.text: We go through crayons pretty fast, and lately the colors have been a hit! These tablets are way more concentrated than those in the Elmo pouches at the store. These are smaller and more vivid. I read other reviews saying that you need to have sealed grout or the crayons stain, and I thought "I just had the bathroom remodeled, I think they must have sealed it?" Nope. So stained.
customer_reviews.author: TKPFB

customer_reviews.title: The bath drops are her absolute favorite thing. My sister reports that there is no ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my small niece and it's getting rave reviews. The bath drops are her absolute favorite thing. My sister reports that there is no tub staining and its easy to use. One tablet makes a nice color but two makes a really deep color. Apparently the crayons are average but you can buy the drops separately for about $7 and I really recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Megan H.

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down or I got a bad batch.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the drops only...haven't used the crayons yet. Disappointed in these color drops...we have ordered these a few different times in the past and the drops really dyed the water. This time around, the container is fancier (with a small flip open lid within the top), but the drops don't do anything! The picture here is the water with a blue drop in it. Previous purchases, the water would've been extremely blue...disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl R

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea!
customer_reviews.text: These, the bath crayons are so hard to clean. Didn’t know you should use it on installed tubs. I would say if you have tile in shower or an actual traditional bath tub these would work great as the clean up front the tile was easy but not the tub. It would be a great gift though. The water changing tablets are also nice. It also helps to teach the kids how colors mix together make other colors like yellow and blue makes green. My kids love theM more than the crayons I think.
customer_reviews.author: Letitia and Hosam

customer_reviews.title: Stains the tub
customer_reviews.text: I love that these come with so many color options. However, they stained the crap out of my shower! We have the Crayola swirled bath crayons & those don’t stain at all. I’ll stick with those which is disappointing because these colors are so fun! They just need to get the formula under control for the staining
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: bath bombs good crayons not so much
customer_reviews.text: We've used these bath bombs before and they are great never leave any residue. The crayons however the darker ones DO NOT come off our white back splash in the bath that well, i've tried bleach and used a magic erase. Won't order the set any more. I've used crayola washable paints in this tub/walls and comes off so good so i think we'll stick to that instead.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Crownshaw

customer_reviews.title: These crayons are awesome, our 19 month old twin boys love them
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are awesome, our 19 month old twin boys love them. It's really taken bath time down a notch of craziness. They really get engaged when they're drawing on the tub with these. The crayons draw very well on the side of the tub, they make really legible thick marks. And with a washcloth and hot water it comes right off in just a single firm wipe.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Curry

customer_reviews.title: Fun but hard on my daughter's skin
customer_reviews.text: Although this was initially great fun for my daughter, and it seemed to rub off easily, after about a week she developed a significant case of eczema. From her hairline to her bum. We racked our brains, cleaned, bought hypoallergenic everything, washed all of her clothes. Finally figured out it was these.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Buy this WITHOUT the crayons
customer_reviews.text: No no no! The color tabs are the best and the kids LOVE them but the crayons are a BIG NO! They stained the shower, they kept breaking off when my daughter was using them. They didn’t write very well and they were really hard to scrub off using the strongest cleaners! The color tabs are really a big hit though. I’d buy the tabs a million x’s over.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Love the drops...crayons not so much
customer_reviews.text: My son loves to take color baths. We has used the tabs before and they are great. We just ran out of tub paints and I thought the crayons might be a less messy alternative. I was wrong. They are really hard to get off of the wall/tub and they break really easily so there are little chunks of crayon all over the tub. My son did love them for the two baths they lasted for but I won't buy them again and will go back to the paints.
customer_reviews.author: Kirbi

customer_reviews.title: and we absolutely love turning our bath water various colors and shades of ...
customer_reviews.text: These crayons stay sharp longer than others my toddler has tried, and we absolutely love turning our bath water various colors and shades of colors. Nothing stays on the skin, and a little scrubbing removes crayon color from the tub as well.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Not to buy
customer_reviews.text: I didnt like the colors its not easy to clean and if the surface wet its not gonna write you will have to dry it while the kids in the tub otherwise i liked only the table colors
customer_reviews.author: Ghada Hussain Alrefaey

customer_reviews.title: We love this set!!
customer_reviews.text: My babies (2 and 4) love this set! With the crayons, color changing tabs and bubbles theyll try and stay in the tub til the water starts getting cold. So glad I bought this! I also suggest washing the crayon away after there out of the tub and not waiting.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly CTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers and up
customer_reviews.text: My now 5 year old has been using these crayola bath crayons for years. As long as you keep them out of the water, they work great. When they’ve been sitting in the bath they tend to crumble. They wipe off super easily with a Clorox wipe. The bath drops turn the water vivid shades which is really cool. The color doesn’t stain skin but they will dry your skin out a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Laura L

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time and money!
customer_reviews.text: Worst thing ever! Very pasty and flimsy. The tip broke instantly and they don’t even write. The second one I used is a munchkin brand one and it’s way better! Don’t waste your money. They are very skinny and weak.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Valencia

customer_reviews.title: Best bathtime investment ever!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old is in love with this product. He gets excited at bath time because we let him pick his colors. The crayons are SO easy to wash off. Pro tip: walls of the tub only... not the floor of the tub... that’s not as easy to clean. I’m 7 months pregnant and my son is 2. Instead of leaning over and wiping the crayon off the wall myself, I give him a little wash rag and he has fun coloring and wiping it away himself!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Hippo

customer_reviews.title: Love the color tabs... HATE THE CRAYONS
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the color tabs, they dissolve quickly and don't leave my sons skin colored. The crayons... well... they suck. they crumble and break quickly. They are pretty water resistant. Had to use bleach to get all the color off the tub and walls.
customer_reviews.author: Goalie333

customer_reviews.title: Crayons do not wipe off!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our boys and the crayons are impossible to clean off. My husband had to clean it off the tile because it takes serious elbow grease to scrub the crayon off. I was horrified! The tabs are fun though and rinse easily out of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Smellslikepop

customer_reviews.title: Makes bath time fun
customer_reviews.text: My 3 y/o request them with almost every bath. They do work pretty quickly and I've never had any problems with them staining the tub. My only request is that there would more color options. I know I can combine them but that color never comes out as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get the crayons!
customer_reviews.text: I remembered loving the bathtub changing tablets when I was younger so I got these for my son as a stocking stuffer. I’m now realizing why we never had the crayons.. lol. Not easy at all to wash off the bathtub so I will probably toss them. The tablets are just as cool as I remember them though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The crayons are terrible, they break immediately and I would not recommend. The only reason for the 2 stars is because the bath color tablets are great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to get a toddler to bathe!
customer_reviews.text: My little one LOVES taking a bath with these. He's excited to pick the colors and hop in. We usually use at least two to make the colors vibrant. They never stain. The colors are blue, yellow, and red (which is more pinkish) and can be mixed to make others. Purple is a favorite in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyne S. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant, Colorful Bath Set
customer_reviews.text: I loved how much came with this package. The tablet left behind a little bit of color on our shower mat and tub but should be easy enough to bleach away. The magenta color was so bright and vivid. My girls love this for their shared baths.
customer_reviews.author: AMessofStalters

customer_reviews.title: don't do it
customer_reviews.text: Water color drops where great. The crayons on the other hand, absolutely not a great idea. They are extremely hard to remove, especially if the child is a bit aggressive, which our nephew was seeing as he was excited about drawing on the tub with crayons.
customer_reviews.author: Kati

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs down 👎
customer_reviews.text: I had the crayola bath tabs before and they had WAY more pigment. These are terrible. You have to use half the container to color the water. As far as the crayons go, I’m not impressed. They break easily and don’t last. Won’t be ordering again.
customer_reviews.author: RTombridge

customer_reviews.title: our grandchildren love to take baths and "go swimming" in our large whirlpool tub.
customer_reviews.text: the only thing they want in addition to this are bubbles! they get plenty dirty playing outside on our farm property, but they so look forward to their baths here with us! and then they are ready for bed after their story. these quality Crayola products add so much to their experience.
customer_reviews.author: C. KISER

customer_reviews.title: Child loved it, Mom did not
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved playing with the bath crayons. She gets to practice her writing/drawing skills and has fun doing it. Mom did not like it. It's difficult to clean and it required a lot of elbow grease to clean off the walls of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The color drops did not work. We used 3 in a shallow bath and the bath water was barely tinted. Our last drops took one to color the bath in a bright color. The crayons are very thin and broke the first time she used them. We may only get 2 uses out of them. Extremely disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Bachmann

customer_reviews.title: Kinda worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: The color tabs are GREAT! Excellent way to learn about mixing primary colors. The crayons are a different story. They don't work. They are too soft so you can't actually draw anything. Thankfully they are fairly easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: samantha

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it. Red crayon stains tub.
customer_reviews.text: Left red crayon drawing on our tub from one bath to the next and it stained the tub wall. Faded after cleaning but could still see the lines. Other colors didn’t seem to stain. So we just tossed out all the red from now on.
customer_reviews.author: klw

customer_reviews.title: Great to entertained during bath
customer_reviews.text: I was having a hard time to get my son into bath. He used to cry the whole time. Now he enjoys it. He draws with the crayons while I clean him and there is no more crying. Very easy to clean afterwards. We haven't used the color drops yet.
customer_reviews.author: Flavia

customer_reviews.title: Don't draw well and they stain
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are terrible to draw with, they don't leave an even line, just gobs of crayon on the side of your tub. I have a standard tub liner, the same one in 90% of homes in the US, and these left stains on my tub from the very first use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Huge drop in product quality
customer_reviews.text: These used to be great, but sometime in the last year the formula changed on both the bath drops and the crayons. The drops barely color the water anymore, and the crayons are super waxy and don’t write as well. Additionally, the drops now stain both tub and skin. According to Crayola’s website, they partner with a company called Centric Beauty to manufacture these. They are no longer making them in the USA, which may explain the drop in quality. Too bad because my kid really liked these. I will not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed kids!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these crayons before Christmas last year. My kids loved them. They lasted 2.5 months of almost everyday use and so I decided to buy them again. Total waste of money 2nd time around. Crayons were stiff. Kids were not able to draw - they crushed into crust small pieces when drawing. Threw them away after 1 week of disappointing use. They were probably ruined by during storage - they could have been several years old - really stiff. Never buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Nemtseva

customer_reviews.title: Colorful bath time!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my son when he was 1 1/2 yrs old and he's loved them since. He's now 2 and still plays with them in the tub. The crayons are alot of fun and actually show up. I love the bath water color changing drops too. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AmyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Loves baths again
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves his bath again. We used up all the color tablets already and still have some crayons left. Hasn't stained out tub at all. We keep a sponge in the tub and my toddler knows to wipe off his drawings when he is done.
customer_reviews.author: Tpenland

customer_reviews.title: TRASH
customer_reviews.text: These are SO hard to clean up. The crayons require serious scrubbing. And the color drops are much less pigmented than the ones I’ve received in the past. Three the crayons right away.
customer_reviews.author: kate washburn

customer_reviews.title: Bath time game changer!
customer_reviews.text: 18 month old daughter LOVES bath time with these. Other reviewers said they stain their tub so I keep a wash cloth close to clean right after bath time and have had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that this package came with alot more crayons then you can purchase at the store. My boys love to take tubbies with being able to chose a color tab and it only takes one to color the whole tub(it does not stain at all) we make bath time fun!
customer_reviews.author: Jemma Raska

customer_reviews.title: Great but be careful with crayons. Bathwater colors no problem
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but deep colors of crayons may stain shower surround. Found soft scrub with bleach works well to remove left over color. Never had problems with bath water colors
customer_reviews.author: steven m zachelmeyer

customer_reviews.title: A must have for bath time
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old just loves these. It extends bathrooms by 30 minutes which means I get a longer break. The crayons remove so easily with a gentle wipe. The little pills don't stain the tub either
customer_reviews.author: S. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: extremely difficult to clean
customer_reviews.text: Crayons pretty but super hard to remove. You have to use cleaner , won’t just come clean with soap and water. Bath water colors not very good either. Have to use more to color water than when used in past.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Weilbaecher

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware false advertising
customer_reviews.text: Not happy! I only received the bath tablets & not any crayons! And I have ordered this product before - buyer beware! Once I contacted them they said it was a mistake & sent me to correct order.
customer_reviews.author: Heather H.

customer_reviews.title: Made Bath Time More Popular
customer_reviews.text: Theses were great. On other listings, I read reviews from people who were miffed the bath dropz were all one color; with this purchase, the bath dropz were mixed: red, blue, and yellow tablets. They mix well so you can have every color in the rainbow. If you put just a drop of water on them, they get really fizzy-very amusing. The crayons weren't as popular with my 3 year old but they are good quality-don't fall apart in the water and wash off fairly easily.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Tablets are Great, crayons break too easily
customer_reviews.text: The bath tablets are great, this is the 3rd time I'm buying them. The crayons break too easily. The concept was great, it keeps my toddler in the tub long enough but I loose the ones I take out to breaks and smashes. Maybe buy thicker ones next time.
customer_reviews.author: ATW

customer_reviews.title: They’re fun, but they stain
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are a lot of fun for my little one but they do stain. I will let her use them in her pool outside going forward so I don’t have to scrub this out of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Pk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my cousin's 3 year old and she loves them! She is learning about how colors mix and they have trouble getting her out of the bath now. This combined with bath crayons and she never wants to get out of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Tov

customer_reviews.title: Kid favorite!
customer_reviews.text: My kids don't want to take a bath without the bath dropz anymore! They're fun and surprisingly do not stain the tub at all! After putting the drop in the tub, I was worried it would stain because of how colored the water got, but I had nothing to worry about!
customer_reviews.author: IAST

customer_reviews.title: So easy to clean, thank goodness
customer_reviews.text: This "art" had been up for a couple days and you can see how easy it comes off with just one swipe on a wet wash cloth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My son got these as a stocking stuffer this past Christmas and I'm honestly surprised how easy it has been to clean off the side of the tub compared to other bath crayons he has had in the past. He is also in love with the fact he can change his bath color.
customer_reviews.author: Marlee

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old was petrified of baths
customer_reviews.text: He screamed like he was being tortured the entire bath. Luckily, he loves to draw so I bought this and some hair washing visors and no more screaming or crying. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Msb

customer_reviews.title: Great price and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Crayons: Certain colors are harder to get off than others but none have stained yet. Bathdrops: i haven't had any problems with staining. Rinses right out
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Blackburn

customer_reviews.title: STAINS
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT wash off with water. It took two adults 15 minutes of scrubbing with Lysol and our bathtub is still tinted red.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Bad Mushy Crayons But Great Bath Drops
customer_reviews.text: I bought crayola bc we love their crayons, but these bath crayons were a waste of money. I would have returned them if my daughter didn’t snap half of them immediately.
